Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Heliomicin (HEL-WT, natural AMPs; defensins; insects,  arthropods, invertebrates, animals; BBMm_GlcCerMOA; 3S=S; UCSS1a; Derivatives: Hel-LL)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  3 Disulphide bridges:7,32; 18,40; 22,42.Activity: Active against C. albicans and P. pastoris.MOA:fungi:: Similar to plant defensin RsAFP2 (also in structure), it interacts with glucosylceramide isolated from the membranes of yeast and soybean but not humans (J Biol Chem 2004; 279: 3900-3905).Transgenic plants: expression of this peptide in tobacco improves resistance to pathogens (Montesinos E 2007 FEMS Microbiol Lett 270, 1-11).SAR:  Based on sequence alignment with defensins from the insect family, residues K23 and R24 at the end of the helix of heliomicin were altered to leucines, leading to a gain in antibacterial activity due to the generation of an amphipathic helix.Structure:  It has an identical fold to the WT.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.  Updated 8/2010; 2/2014; formatted 9/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Lamberty M, Caille A, Landon C, Tassin-Moindrot S, Hetru C, Bulet P, Vovelle F.2001
Literature Information.Title: Solution Structures of the Antifungal Heliomicin and a Selected Variant with Both Antibacterial and Antifungal Activities.
